intro: Silene saxifraga var. pirinica, commonly known as the Pirin catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh conditions. Silene saxifraga var. pirinica is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy flowers and ecological importance in alpine ecosystems.
